trans-unit.source: Defines the relationship between a data item and the node it is binding to in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView"></xref> control.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source where each data item contains multiple fields (such as an XML element with several attributes), a node displays the value that is returned by the `ToString` method of the data item, by default.
In the case of an XML element, the node displays the element name, which shows the underlying structure of the tree, but is not very useful otherwise.
You can bind the properties of a node to a specific field by specifying tree node bindings.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object defines the relationship between each data item and the node that it is binding to.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control stores its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.DataBindings%2A> property and applies the bindings to the data source to create a one-to-one relationship between the tree hierarchy and the data source hierarchy.

For each data item in the data source, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control attempts to match the data item to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object in order to create the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
When creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object, you must specify the criteria for binding.
The criteria indicates when a data item should be bound to a node.
You can specify the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties.
There is a slight performance gain by specifying both.
A node depth specifies the node level that gets bound.

For example, the following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> declaration binds the `Name` and `ID` fields of the data source to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> properties, respectively, of all nodes with a depth of 0:
A data member specifies the type of the data item in the underlying data source, but can represent different information depending on the data source.

Each data item in a hierarchical data source (represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchyData?displayProperty=fullName> interface) exposes a <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchyData.Type%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which specifies the type of the data item.
For example, the data member for an XML element specifies the name of the element.
When a data source contains multiple data item types, the data member specifies which data item type to use.

The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> declaration binds the `<Book>` elements of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource> control to all the nodes in the tree, regardless of the location in the hierarchy:
Once the binding criteria is established, you can then bind a property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object that can be bound to a value.
You can bind to a field of a data item or to a static value.
When bound to a static value, all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied share the same value.
You can selectively override a bound property in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object by setting the corresponding property directly in the node.

The following table lists the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> class that allow you to bind a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field of a data item.
Property
Description
The field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.

The following table lists the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> class that allow you to bind a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a static value.
Property
Description
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.PopulateOnDemand%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.SelectAction%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ShowCheckBox%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The static value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.

If conflicting <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> objects are defined, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control applies the tree node bindings in the following order of precedence:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object that defines and matches both a depth and a data member.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object that defines and matches the data member only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object that defines and matches the depth only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object that defines neither the depth nor the data member.
(This type of tree node binding is applied to all nodes in the tree.)
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object that does not have a match in the data source.

In this case, the value that is returned by the `ToString` method of the data item is then bound to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> properties of the nodes to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> class also allows you to format the text that is displayed in a node by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.FormatString%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> class.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.%23ctor%2A> constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> class.
It is often used when dynamically populating the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.DataBindings%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control.
Gets or sets the value to match against a <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchyData.Type"></xref> property for a data item to determine whether to apply the tree node binding.
A data member specifies the type of the data item in the underlying data source, but can represent different information depending on the data source.

Each data item in a hierarchical data source (represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchyData?displayProperty=fullName> object) exposes a <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchyData.Type%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which specifies the type of the data item.
For example, the data member for an XML element specifies the name of the element.
When a data source contains multiple data item types, the data member specifies which data item type to use.

The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> declaration binds the `<Book>` elements of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource> control to all the nodes in the tree, regardless of the location in the hierarchy:
When creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object, you must specify the criteria for binding.
The criteria indicates when a data item should be bound to a node.
You can specify the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties.
There is a slight performance gain by specifying both.
Once the binding criteria is established, you can then bind a property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object that can be bound to a value.
You can bind to a field of a data item or to a static value.
When bound to a static value, all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied share the same value.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The value to match against a data item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchyData.Type"></xref> property to determine whether to apply the tree node binding.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the node depth at which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
A node depth specifies the node level that gets bound.

For example, the following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> declaration binds the `Name` and `ID` fields of the data source to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> properties, respectively, of all nodes with a depth of 0:
When creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object, you must specify the criteria for binding.
The criteria indicates when a data item should be bound to a node.
You can specify the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties.
There is a slight performance gain by specifying both.
Once the binding criteria is established, you can then bind a property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object that can be bound to a value.
You can bind to a field of a data item or to a static value.
When bound to a static value, all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied share the same value.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The node depth at which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is -1, indicating that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the string that specifies the display format for the text of a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.FormatString%2A> property is used to provide a custom format for a node's text.
The data format string consists of two parts, separated by a colon, in the form { `A` : `Bxx` }.
For example, the formatting string `{0:F2}` displays a fixed-point number with two decimal places.
The entire string must be enclosed in braces to indicate that it is a format string and not a literal string.
Any text outside the braces is displayed as literal text.
The value before the colon (`A` in the general example) specifies the parameter index in a zero-based list of parameters.
This value can be set only to 0 because there is only one value in each node.
The character after the colon (`B` in the general example) specifies the display format for the value.
The following table lists the common formats.
Format character
Displays numeric values in
Currency format.
Decimal format.
Scientific (exponential) format.
Fixed format.
General format.
Number format.
Hexadecimal format.
Except for `X`, the format character is not case sensitive.
The `X` format character displays the hexadecimal characters in the case that is specified.
The value after the format character (`xx` in the general example) specifies the number of significant digits or decimal places to display.
For more information on formatting strings, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.FormatString%2A> property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
A formatting string that specifies the display format for the text of a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.FormatString"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the ToolTip text for the image that is displayed next to a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTip%2A> property to specify the value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The text that you specify provides Assistive Technology devices with a description of the image that can be used to make the control more accessible.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
When an image is displayed next to a node, the ToolTip text is displayed when the mouse pointer is positioned over the image.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTip%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTip%2A> property to bind the same ToolTip text to each node image, you can bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field of a data source by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTipField%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The ToolTip text for the image that is displayed next to a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the P:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTip property is not set.

Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTipField%2A> property to specify the field name to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The text that you specify provides Assistive Technology devices with a description of the image that can be used to make the control more accessible.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
When an image is displayed next to a node, the ToolTip text is displayed when the mouse pointer is positioned over the image.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTipField%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTipField%2A> property to bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip%2A> property to a fixed value by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTip%2A> property.

If the data source contains multiple fields, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties in order to bind to the appropriate field.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The name of the field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageToolTip"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTipField"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the URL to an image that is displayed next to a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrl%2A> property to specify a custom image to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The image is displayed next to a node and can be in any file format (.jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on), as long as the client browser supports that format.
You can override the image for an individual node by setting its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property directly.

Instead of using this property to bind the same image to each node, you can bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field of a data source by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrlField%2A> property.

When displaying an image next to a node with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrl%2A> property, you should also consider setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTip%2A> property.
The ToolTip text that you specify provides Assistive Technology devices with a description of the image that can be used to make the control more accessible.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The URL to an image that is displayed next to a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The
<xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrl"></xref> property is not set.

Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrlField%2A> property to specify the name of the field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The image is displayed next to a node and can be in any file format (.jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on), as long as the client browser supports the format.
You can override the image for an individual node by setting its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property directly.

Instead of using this property to bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property to a fixed value by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrl%2A> property.

If the data source contains multiple fields, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties in order to bind to the appropriate field.

When displaying an image next to a node with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrlField%2A> property, you should also consider setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageToolTipField%2A> property.
The ToolTip text that you specify provides Assistive Technology devices with a description of the image that can be used to make the control more accessible.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The name of the field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ImageUrlField"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the URL to link to when a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied is clicked.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
When this property is set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control displays a hyperlink for the text of the node, instead of plain text.
You can also optionally set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property to specify the window or frame in which to display the linked content.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrl%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrl%2A> property to bind the same URL to each node, you can bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field of a data source by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrlField%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The URL to link to when a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied is clicked.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrl"></xref> property is not set.

Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrlField%2A> property to specify the field name to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrlField%2A> property is set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control displays a hyperlink for the text of the node, instead of plain text.
You can also optionally set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property to specify the window or frame in which to display the linked content.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrlField%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrlField%2A> property to bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl%2A> property to a fixed value by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrl%2A> property.

If the data source contains multiple fields, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties in order to bind to the appropriate field.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The name of the field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.NavigateUrl"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrlField"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied is populated dynamically.
Sometimes, it is not practical to statically predefine the tree structure due to data size or custom content that depends on user input.
Because of this, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control supports dynamic node population.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.PopulateOnDemand%2A> property is set to `true`, the child nodes of the node that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied to gets populated at run time when the node is expanded.

When data bindings are created by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.AutoGenerateDataBindings%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control to `true`, the bindings that are created have the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.PopulateOnDemand%2A> property set to `true`.
Data bindings that are created declaratively have the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.PopulateOnDemand%2A> property set to `false`.
Using the declarative syntax allows you to control the behavior of individual data bindings.

Unlike the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.PopulateOnDemand%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.PopulateOnDemand%2A> property does not require an event-handling method to be defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodePopulate> event, if you are using a data source control, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.XmlDataSource>.

Instead, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control dynamically generates an event-handling method using the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.DataBindings%2A> collection.

You can still define an event-handling method for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodePopulate> event; however, it will be called after the event-handling method for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control.
Supported browsers can also take advantage of client-side node population.

When enabled, this allows the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control to populate a node dynamically on the client when that node is expanded, preventing the need to post back to the server.
For more information on client-side node population, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.PopulateNodesFromClient%2A>.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
`true` to populate the node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied dynamically; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the event or events to raise when a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied is selected.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.SelectAction%2A> property to specify the value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.SelectAction%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.SelectAction%2A> property is used to specify which event or events are raised when a node is selected.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.SelectAction%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.SelectAction%2A> property of each node directly.
The following table lists the available options.
`SelectAction` value
Description
Toggles the node between expanded and collapsed.
Raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodeExpanded> event or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodeCollapsed> event, as appropriate.
Raises no events when a node is selected.
Raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.SelectedNodeChanged> event when a node is selected.
Raises both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.SelectedNodeChanged> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodeExpanded> events when a node is selected.
Nodes are only expanded, never collapsed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.HoverNodeStyle%2A> is not rendered for a node with its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.SelectAction%2A> property set to `TreeNodeSelectAction.None`.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeSelectAction"></xref> values.
The default is `TreeNodeSelectAction.Select`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed next to a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
To provide multinode selection support in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control, you can display check boxes next to an image in the node.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ShowCheckBox%2A> property to specify the value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ShowCheckBox%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ShowCheckBox%2A> property is used to show or hide the check box for a node.

Although the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ShowCheckBox%2A> property can be used to display check boxes, it is more common to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ShowCheckBoxes%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control.

However, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ShowCheckBoxes%2A> property affects every node type that is specified by the property; therefore, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ShowCheckBox%2A> property is often used to override that setting for a node to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ShowCheckBox%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ShowCheckBox%2A> property of each node directly.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
`true` to display a check box next to a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.

Gets or sets the target window or frame in which to display the Web page content that is associated with a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property to specify the value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property is used to specify the window or frame in which to display the Web content that is linked to a node when that node is clicked.

Setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.Target%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control for the nodes to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property of each node directly.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property renders as a `target` attribute.
The `target` attribute on `anchor` elements is not allowed in the XHTML 1.1 document type definition.

Do not set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property, if the rendered output for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> control must be XHTML 1.1 compliant.
For more information, see [XHTML Standards in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1b78d416-66bb-43a5-ac77-c703aab55b97).
When creating accessible Web pages, you should avoid using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property to target another window.
For more information, see [NIB: ASP.NET Accessibility](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/9b5f3e05-e88d-4248-a5f4-9e64850fa0ae).
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The target window or frame in which to display the linked Web page content.
Values must begin with a letter in the range of A through Z (case insensitive), except for certain special values that begin with an underscore, as shown in the following table.
Target value
Description
Renders the content in a new window without frames.
Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
Renders the content in the search pane.
Renders the content in the frame with focus.
Renders the content in the full window without frames.
Check your browser documentation to determine if the `_search` value is supported.
For example, Microsoft Internet Explorer version 5.0 and later supports the `_search` target value.
The default is an empty string (""), which refreshes the window or frame with focus.

Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TargetField%2A> property to specify the field name to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property is used to specify the window or frame in which to display the Web content that is linked to a node when that node is clicked.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TargetField%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TargetField%2A> property to bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field, you can set <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target%2A> property to a fixed value by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Target%2A> property.

If the data source contains multiple fields, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties in order to bind to the appropriate field.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The name of the field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Target"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TargetField"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the text that is displayed for the node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Text%2A> property to specify the value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property is used to specify the text displayed in a node.
You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Text%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Text%2A> property to bind the same text to each node, you can bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field of a data source by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TextField%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text displayed for the node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string ("").

Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TextField%2A> property to specify the field name to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property is used to specify the text displayed in a node.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TextField%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TextField%2A> property to bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property to a fixed value by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Text%2A> property.

If the data source contains multiple fields, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties in order to bind to the appropriate field.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The name of the field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.TextField"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the ToolTip text for a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTip%2A> property to specify the value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The ToolTip text is displayed when the mouse pointer is positioned over the node.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTip%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTip%2A> property to bind the same ToolTip text to each node, you can bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field of a data source by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTipField%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The ToolTip text for a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTip"></xref> property is not set.

Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTipField%2A> property to specify the field name to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
The ToolTip text is displayed when the mouse pointer is positioned over the node.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTipField%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTipField%2A> property to bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip%2A> property to a fixed value by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTip%2A> property.

If the data source contains multiple fields, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties in order to bind to the appropriate field.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The name of the field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ToolTip"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ToolTipField"></xref> property is not set.
Returns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember"></xref> property.
Returns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember"></xref> property.
If the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember"></xref> property is `null` or an empty string (""), **(Empty)** is returned.

Gets or sets a displayed value that is not displayed but is used to store any additional data about a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied, such as data used for handling postback events.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Value%2A> property to specify the value to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property is used to supplement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property by storing any additional data associated with the node to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
This value is not displayed in the control and is commonly used to store data for handling postback events.
You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Value%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Value%2A> property to bind the same value to each node, you can bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to a field of a data source by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ValueField%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
Supplemental data about a node to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied; this data is not displayed.
The default is an empty string ("").

Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control is bound to a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ValueField%2A> property to specify the field name to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object.
This binding relationship affects all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> objects to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property is used to supplement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Text%2A> property by storing any additional data associated with the node to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object is applied.
This value is not displayed in the control and is commonly used to store data for handling postback events.

You can selectively override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ValueField%2A> property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of each node directly.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ValueField%2A> property to bind the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object to an field, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value%2A> property to a fixed value by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Value%2A> property.

If the data source contains multiple fields, you must first set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.Depth%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.DataMember%2A> property, or both properties in order to bind to the appropriate field.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

The name of the field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.Value"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object is applied.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.ValueField"></xref> property is not set.
Creates a copy of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.System%23ICloneable%23Clone%2A> method is a helper function that creates a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> object from which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.System%23ICloneable%23Clone%2A> method is called.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.System%23ICloneable%23Clone%2A> method is used primarily by control developers.
An object that represents a copy of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataSourceViewSchemaAccessor.DataSourceViewSchema"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSourceViewSchemaAccessor> interface.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
An object that represents the schema that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding"></xref> object.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
`true`, if the control is marked to save its state; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved view state for the node.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved view state values.
Saves the view state changes to an object.
The object that contains the view state changes.
Instructs the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object to track changes to its view state.

After the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeBinding.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23TrackViewState%2A> method has been called on a server control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property returns `true`.
